Infirm, sick, ill, feeble, sickly. Infirm.

18.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
18.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.

19.str2: (a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
19.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

19.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
19.str2: To take up, raise; I pick up, take on board; I carry off, lead away. From ana and lambano; to take up.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

19.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
19.str2: Another form for kathezomai; to seat down, i.e. Set; intransitively, to sit; figuratively, to settle.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

20.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
20.str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
20.str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
Everywhere, in all places. Genitive case of a presumed derivative of pas; universally.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
20.str2: To cooperate with, work together. From sunergos; to be a fellow-worker, i.e. Co-operate.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
20.str2: To confirm, ratify, secure, establish; pass: I guarantee. From bebaios; to stabilitate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of semaino; an indication, especially ceremonially or supernaturally.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Plural
20.str2: To follow close after, accompany, dog; I imitate, pursue, be studious of. From epi and akoloutheo; to accompany.
